subject: ? Anthropic $20B Raise, ? Microsoft Unveils Maia 200 Chip, ? Europe Pushes AI Sovereignty.

"? Anthropic $20B Raise, ? Microsoft Unveils Maia 200 Chip, ? Europe Pushes AI Sovereignty.", inspired by Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart.

Hi there, this is your daily dose of AI Brief.

Today?s highlights:

? Anthropic nears $20B raise at $350B valuation.

? OpenAI launches Prism AI workspace for scientists.

? MAGMA memory fix enhances AI agent reasoning.

? Microsoft unveils Maia 200 AI inference chip.

? Europe advances AI sovereignty, limits US tech reliance.

? DSGym benchmarks data science agents on 1000+ tasks.

? Prompt injection remains unsolvable with current LLMs.

? Meta suspends teen access to AI chatbot characters.

? Neuron Behavior Unveiled, ?? AI Regulation Clash, ?? Claude AI Integrations, ? AI Agent Surge, ? Collaborative Filtering Boost, ??? Codex Coding AI, ?? Behavioral AI Defense, ? AI Power Shift.

The Essentials:

[? Anthropic nears $20B raise at $350B valuation.](http://www.techmeme.com/260127/p42#a260127p42)

- Anthropic is nearing a $20B funding round at a $350B valuation, attracting major investors like GIC, Coatue, Iconiq, and Sequoia.
- The raise doubles initial targets, signaling strong investor demand and positioning Anthropic for accelerated growth and R&D.
- This valuation surge reflects heightened competition in AI, with regulatory scrutiny and market dynamics influencing future trajectories.

[? OpenAI launches Prism AI workspace for scientists.](https://techcrunch.com/2026/01/27/openai-launches-prism-a-new-ai-workspace-for-scientists/)

- OpenAI introduced Prism, a free AI workspace integrated with GPT-5.2, designed to enhance scientific paper writing and research workflows.
- Prism supports LaTeX, visual diagram assembly, and context-aware AI responses, aiming to accelerate human-led scientific research and collaboration.
- The tool reflects growing AI adoption in academia, with implications for research rigor, workflow integration, and evolving human-AI partnerships.

[? MAGMA memory fix enhances AI agent reasoning.](https://www.aiacceleratorinstitute.com/ai-agents-struggle-with-why-questions-a-memory-based-fix/)

- Researchers at University of Texas at Dallas and University of Florida developed MAGMA, a multi-graph memory system enhancing AI agent reasoning.
- MAGMA structures memory into temporal, causal, entity, and semantic graphs, improving accuracy on reasoning benchmarks by up to 45.5%.
- Its dual-stream design lowers latency to 1.47s and cuts token use by 95%, addressing long-term AI memory and causal inference challenges.

[? Microsoft unveils Maia 200 AI inference chip.](https://www.techspot.com/news/111072-microsoft-built-750w-ai-chip-challenge-nvidia-dominance.html)

- Microsoft launched the Maia 200 AI inference chip, targeting high-performance AI workloads and competing with Nvidia.
- The 750W chip aims to boost AI processing efficiency, signaling Microsoft's strategic push into custom AI hardware development.
- This move challenges Nvidia's market dominance, raising questions on adoption, performance benchmarks, and regulatory impacts.

[? Europe advances AI sovereignty, limits US tech reliance.](https://www.computerworld.com/article/4121422/europe-votes-to-tackle-deep-dependence-on-us-tech-in-sovereignty-drive.html)

- The European Parliament approved a report directing the European Commission to reduce reliance on non-EU tech providers in chips, cloud, software, and AI.
- The report highlights EU dependence on foreign tech exceeds 80%, urging development of a ?Eurostack? and ?Open Source first? procurement policies.
- Analysts foresee a decade-long transition; success depends on member state alignment and operational sovereignty beyond mere data residency.

[? DSGym benchmarks data science agents on 1000+ tasks.](https://www.marktechpost.com/2026/01/27/dsgym-offers-a-reusable-container-based-substrate-for-building-and-benchmarking-data-science-agents/)

- DSGym introduces a benchmark evaluating data science agents across over 1,000 diverse tasks, enhancing agent performance assessment.
- This benchmark offers a standardized platform for testing agent capabilities, aiding in comparative analysis and development strategies.
- The broad task scope enables comprehensive evaluation, though variability in task complexity may affect benchmarking consistency.

[? Prompt injection remains unsolvable with current LLMs.](https://spectrum.ieee.org/prompt-injection-attack)

- Prompt injection attacks exploit large language models (LLMs) by tricking them into bypassing safety controls, exposing sensitive data or performing forbidden tasks. Bruce Schneier and Barath Raghavan highlight LLMs? vulnerability to crafted prompts that override guardrails, a problem unsolvable with current architectures.
- These attacks reveal fundamental limits in LLMs? operational design, which flatten complex context into token similarity and lack human-like judgment or interruption reflexes. Attempts to patch specific prompt injections are insufficient; robust defense demands novel AI approaches incorporating richer contextual awareness and real-world grounding.
- The challenge intensifies with autonomous AI agents using tools, as their independence and overconfidence increase risks of erroneous actions. Researchers face a security trilemma balancing speed, intelligence, and safety, with no known method to fully immunize LLMs against prompt injection attacks under current paradigms.

[? Meta suspends teen access to AI chatbot characters.](https://www.engadget.com/social-media/meta-is-temporarily-pulling-teens-access-from-its-ai-chatbot-characters-180626052.html?src=rss)

- Meta is suspending teen access to its AI chatbot characters globally due to safety concerns over inappropriate interactions.
- The pause follows reports of sexual conversations with underage users and aims to implement parental controls and updated safeguards.
- Regulators including the FTC and Texas AG are investigating; Meta faces ongoing legal scrutiny over AI chatbot safety for minors.
